doc.after: Most Western languages particularly those with writing systems based on the Latin Cyrillic Greek Coptic and Armenian alphabets use letter cases in their written form as an aid to clarity Scripts using two separate cases are also called bicameral scripts Many other writing systems make no distinction between majuscules and minuscules a system called unicameral script or unicase This includes most syllabic and other non alphabetic scripts The Georgian alphabet is special since it used to be bicameral but today is mostly used in a unicameral way
